summary:
Mr. Van Kammen has 30 years experience as Health & Safety Engineer and Environmental Consultant in both national and international projects. He was involved in multidisciplinary design, construction and operational phases of industrial processes, facilities and buildings. He has extensive knowledge and experience in the civil engineering sector in the construction of engineering works (like buildings, tunnels and bridges) as well as the construction of sewage works and waste water treatment plants (including all mechanical installations) and remediation of disposal sites, contaminated soil and sediment.

Experience is gained in the Oil & Gas, Energy and Chemical Industry for clients like Northern Caspian Organisation Company (NCOC), Tengizchevroil (TCO), BOPEC, Tennet, Stedin and AkzoNobel IC (Nouryon).

The advisory services have not only to specific risks but also on the project risks in all possible phases of a project (planning, tender, implementation and operational /maintenance phase) including demolition. Based on the extensive knowledge and experience in multidisciplinary projects, he is also used to organize and coordinate the safety and risk management of civil and industrial projects. 

He is experienced in project / contract work and is able to to analyze risks but also opportunities. Here he has a preference for a practical and solution-oriented approach.

Specialties: 
1) Safety:
- Safety management
- Risk management
- Auditing and Safety inspections
- Writing of Procedures and Safety plans
- Safety analyses by engineering buildings and installations (like HAZID, HAZOP, SIL, FMEA, What/If)
- Accessibility and maintenance review
- Accident analyses (like Tripod analyses)
- Occupational Health and Safety and prevention of environmental damage as a result of working in contaminated soil and sediment
2) Environmental assessment, soil investigation and soil remediation
3) Investigation to asbestos in buildings, material and soil and safe removal or remediation of asbestos

school.name: Institute for post higher professional education in Safety & Health (PHOV)

projects.title: Renovation Heinenoord tunnel
projects.description:
H&S / Integral safety consultant 'Renovation of the first Heinenoord tunnel'.
The tunnel connects the Hoeksche Waard with the island of IJsselmonde and is named after the nearby Heinenoord. The tunnel is part of the A29. The tunnel was built as an immersion tunnel with tunnel segments of 8.8 meters high, 30.7 meters wide and 115 meters long and was commissioned in 1969. The tunnel has two (traffic) pipes and is currently not equipped with a middle tunnel channel (MTK). 
To enable the tunnel to comply with the National Tunnel Standard (LTS), it will be renovated. The work required for this purpose relates to civil engineering work such as the construction of a middle-tunnel channel and the renovation of the tunnel technical installations.

Risk inventory based on risk sessions, preparations of safety plan and safety files (Integral Safety plan), substantiate and motivate design choices (structural, technical and organizational).
Performing of a contra expertise on asbestos research, research on chromium VI and other possible pollutions in dust and coatings.

projects.title: Oosterweel Link Antwerp
projects.description:
Since June 2017 Health and Safety Management.
The Oosterweel link extends over a length of approximately 15 km. By means of a new tunnel under the river Scheldt, the Oosterweel link will connect the E17 (Ghent) and the E34/N49 (Bruges) on the left bank with the E19/A12 motorways towards the Netherlands and E34/E313 towards Liège, Germany and Luxembourg. The project consists of five main parts:
Left bank & Zwijndrecht, The Scheldt tunnel, The Oosterweel junction, The Canal Tunnels, R1-North

projects.title: Participant platform of CROW publication 400
projects.description:
The CROW publication 400 is about Health and Safety when working in and with contaminated soil or sediments.

CROW publication 132 'Working in or with contaminated soil and / or contaminated (ground) water' is a further elaboration of the requirements of the Working Conditions Decree, specifically aimed at working with contaminated soil. The contents of this publication are no laws or regulations, but is seen as the state of scientific knowledge and professional services in the field of working with contaminated soil. The Health and Safety Catalogue for the building and infrastructure referred to the publication as the standard to be used for working with contaminated soil.

CROW publication 307 'Cables and pipes in contaminated soil' is a guideline for the safe and careful work on underground line infrastructure. This Directive is therefore directed to the branch cables and pipelines and complementary to CROW 132.

projects.title: Sanitation of Former gas factory Maastricht
projects.description:
This site is know as Maagdendries / Lindenkruis. Client is the Municipality of Maastricht
Preparation environmental safety plan for the remediation of gas holders to protect the people in the immediate vicinity of the pollution. These gas holders were filled with severely polluted soil with free cyanide and volatile aromatic compounds. The environmental safety (omgevingsveiligheid) is coordinated with the Public Health Service and other stakeholders. Before the start of the excavation a safety instruction is given to the employees of the contractor (arbeidsveiligheid als HVK).

projects.title: Participant evaluation asbestos standards (NEN5707/5797/5798/5727)
projects.description:
NEN 5707: 2015, Soil - Inspection and sampling of asbestos in soil
NEN 5897: 2015 Inspection and sampling of asbestos in construction and demolition waste and recycled aggregates
NEN 5898: 2015, Determination of asbestos in soil, sediment, construction and demolition waste and granulated

The NTA 5727 "Asbestos in sediment"​ will be used in the revised NEN 5720 "Soil - Sediment - Strategy for conducting exploratory research - Research into the environmental quality of sediment and dredging sludge."

The remediation of asbestos-containing materials is part of this.

projects.title: Development of the landfill Semakau (Singapore)
projects.description: Consultancy study on development of the landfill Semakau, phase 1. Part of the contract is to conduct an environmental and geotechnical soil investigation. The Semakau landfill comprises a small island at app. 7 km south of Singapore. The phase 1 of the landfill has an area of 176 hectare (Ha) that consist of 15 landfill cells of varying sizes. Most of the content consist of incineration ash (IA) and non-incinerable waste (NIW). Asbestos and treated industrial waste (TIW) are also being landfilled in varying quantities at certain cells. Due to the presence of asbestos, advice was given about the risk factors and control measures to be taken to prevent the spread and exposure to asbestos. A work plan has been drawn up, and employees are trained to recognize the risks and to apply the correct control measures.

projects.title: Redevelopment Landfill (HCH contaminated)
projects.description:
As part of the redevelopment of the landfill site in Deventer, a risk analysis has been carried out into the HCH contamination that has been demonstrated in the cover layer of the Landfill. 
The analysis focused on the potential exposure of the users of the site and employees who perform (excavation) work in the contaminated soil.

profile_positions.description:
Health & Safety Engineer at infrastructure projects, liketunnels, railways, bridges, locks, flood defenses,  buildings, and quay walls. 

HSE Engineer water treatment plants such as waste water treatment plants, waste water recovery plants and drink water plants.

HSE engineer for drawing up risk analyzes and risk management plans in case of residual contaminants in the soil, landfills and buildings. The risk analyzes are aimed at the potential exposure of (future) users and employees who carry out management and maintenance in the realized building or infrastructure. Necessary technical and organizational control measures were also described and advice was given on monitoring and maintenance issues.

As a safety expert he is involved within many projects for the sanitation of severely polluted soil (HVK/DLP). For demolition and renovation of buildings, advise is given on investigation and removing of asbestos. For several clients a health and safety plans are written or reviewed.
profile_positions.title: Health, Safety and Environmental Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Some of the international projects are (see also projects): 
- H&S expert at Remediation of Noor Mohammad Kunta, Kattedan Industrial Area in Rangareddy District, Andhra Pradesh, India (2011-2012). 
- H&S expert at Containment of Municipal Solid Waste Site at Ukkayyapalli, Kadapa in Andhra Pradesh, India (2011-2012).
- HSE Lead engineer SWS Water Treatment Recovery Plant, Kazakhstan (2015 - 2016)
- Palm Beach Aruba (2017)
profile_positions.title: International Experience

profile_positions.description: Mr. Van Kammen has extensive experience with respect to projects related to contaminated soil, contaminated groundwater and sediments as well as risk assessments. As a manager and an environmental engineer he has been involved in many investigation and clean up projects according to Dutch (NEN) and international (ISO) standards for a broad range of clients.
